ok, this started as a comment in rara8777 journal.  but it was going to be really long, and I wanted to share it with you guys.  

it started when I read there was going to be 4 more seasons of house.  I can see that ending horribly, there's only so many avenues with medical shows and they have used up almost of all of their collateral.   just like the x-files, it'll be a long, painful ending.  *sighs*   here are some of my thoughts...

  I sort of understood the logic behind getting rid of the ducklings, but they chose their replacements so poorly.  Taulb is just a bizarre choice, he has no chemistry with the team at all.  In fact, he throws off any potential chemistry betw kal penn and 13. It's one of the reasons the show was so good, the three of them had chemistry from the beginning.  I like those two, they could develop some chemistry (not nec. physical).  Penn is just hilarious and 13 plays off it well.  but they need to bring back cammy!  even my dad said so.  maybe they'll shoot taulb because he is just annoying.  bring back the old dude who wasn't really a doctor.  there also needs to be more clinic, since that seems to have been almost completely eliminated.  they provided much needed comic relief, and were sometimes the most interesting parts of the episode.  the old woman with syphilis...you are destined to feel good forever.  LOL.  
  why don't these producers realize when they are reaching their peak, and can go no further???  the only show I can think of that went out at the top of it's game was buffy (of the shows I watched).  certainly not x-files, alias, or ER.  IMHO, CSI and house should have their series finale this year.  what is CSI without grissom?  he's the focal point of the show, it was even brought up in season 2 how he's the supervisor and people are making a family around him.  they also tried that half season where catherine was a supervisor, with warrick and nicky under her.  that was kind of the beginning of the end for me.  it was like that didn't even happen after the season 5 finale.  .  and they replaced him with lawrence fishburn?  does anyone else find that weird?  I haven't seen him ANYWHERE in years.  I don't know why they didn't just make catherine the supervisor.  it's the logically choice...I don't know.  we'll see what happens...

I know, not personal.  one of these days I will write an entry about my trip to disney.  i'm still trying to catch up with everyone else's journals.  which is actually where this one started out...my brain is fried.  i go bed soon, I think.  

you guys rock if you read all the way down to here.  and I wouldn't blame you even a little if you didn't.  *does tired jig*

Since at least one of my friends didn't see it, I made ample room.  ok, did I miss something in a previous episode about warrick getting divorced?  It definitely wasn't a shocker, actually it's surprising it didn't happen sooner.  Feel bad for him, and he's right about the team being disconnected.  For me, that's the thing that's missing the past two seasons.  the team interaction has somehow gotten lost, and it's an after thought.  NOT SPIFFY.  that's what made it so great.  yay for nicky stepping up and calling him on the pill poppin'.  I wonder what his reaction is going to be to this thing.  hell, I wonder what all their reactions are going to be.  But they probably won't show that, much like they didn't show everybody's reaction to sara leaving.  except for the blurbs by greg, and of all people hodges (but that really wasn't about sara, it was more about grissom).  Have these writer's lost their ability to form connections between people?  they must have different writers or something...I dunno.  This epi was good, but I knew as soon as warrick came back to the club in the cab that something bad was going down.  I did like the directing on this episode, it was very well done. they better show catherine's reactions, esp. with their history.  we'll see what happens.  and unlike other shows (e.g. House) it is actually on next week.    any thoughts you guys? 

-lex

I really liked this one (shocker).  as was pointed out in 
houseketeer 's
review, there were some awesome lines in this one.  Since I'm lazy and don't want to be redundant (since we have a few mutual friends), I'll let you check her journal if you want to.  I almost felt bad for ctb.  but WOO for #13 staying on, even if it was only because of cuddy.  I knew there had to be a chick, who else would answer his mail?  or be eye candy :-)

the guy dying is pretty...love his eyes, esp. with eyeliner.  he can fuck me any day...

he can never play piano enough...*drools*

is anyone else annoyed by foreman? 

- the chase/plastic surgeon guy banter exchange(still not the right word).  "no, but that's how it's going to play out."  the look on chase's face was priceless. (sorry for the strikethrough, let me know if any of you think of a better word, please)
- "You took away my happiness"  by telling you that you were going to live?  that makes very little sense.  I mean, I can understand initially being pissed.  but you are going to live.  this is usually considered to be better than death.  house was right, he was pissed because now he's going to be boring again and no one will pay attention to the pitiful loser.  the fact that house advised him was hilarious "I was looking out for my bottom line"
-loved the house/wilson banter at the end. wilson is right, though.  he does have to control everything.  which is one of the many reasons CTB had to be fired.
-"see competition works"  LOL
-I totally understand the hanging out with kids thing.  I'm much better at dealing with kids than adults...so much so I usually get dragged away at family functions (e.g. baby showers, new year's eve parties)

ok...wtf was that?  I knew she was leaving the show, but I didn't think she was leaving HIM.  he finally lets someone in, and WHAM she leaves.  soo didn't see that happening.  but my other friend did, so I don't know...  *shrugs* .  he looked so crushed, and after he asked her to marry him and everything.  I hadn't liked how they handled the sara thing up to this point, but tonight's episode made sense to her character (except for her detachment from the domestic violence thing, that was bizarre considering her history.  I dunno...it's just so sad.  I did love the kiss though. 
rara8777
must have squealed when that happened.  I dunno...we'll see how grissom adjusts to this.  I feel so bad for him.  must be like a flashback to butterflied (season 4 episode with the doctor) to that monologue he did to the doctor.  It'll also be interestesting to see how the team reacts.  I dunno...the way the ended it fit sara's character.  she pushes people away, esp. when she's vulnerable.  much like grissom.  no GSR for awhile...all sorts of not spiffy. 

-lex

Loved this bit when the CIA dude and house are going up to the platform:  "CIA?  come on, that's a bit much (paraphrasing)".  CIA guy on top with black ops helicopter:  "props help"  LOL.
I loved it, esp. when wilson called CIA headquarters and house was there.  the look on his face was awesome.  Also liked the fact that house's cell has cutthroat bitch as the name for whoever.  

dude, I couldn't believe that freak poisoned the chick with whatever. that shit doesn't fly post -Tuskeegee.  fucking whack job.  

I still heart cammy, esp. at the end with foreman.  she doesn't belong in the ER, but I'm not going to complain because she's on the show.  

does anyone else think there's going to be a mutiny among the potential ducklings when they find out one of them has been upsurped by someone who didn't go through the process along with them?  I know I would.  so that leaves two spots, right?  I like her though, she's a good actress.  Was on er and I think homicide, as well.  I predict mutiny though.  it'll be interesting to see what happens next week.  

-lex :-)

I really liked this episode.  it had a lot of team interaction and the cases were cool.  My main problem with last season was there wasn't much team interaction, and everyone seemed to just kind of be there or something.  My brain's fried, so I can't think of a better word.  the ending was really puzzling.  like sara seemed happy at the track, but also not.  so I don't know what that was about.  Grissom is like me, he doesn't do subtlety.  If she didn't want to switch to swing-shift she shouldn't have suggested it.  And maybe Catherine could have just done her evals.  I dunno.  but she didn't seem all that happen at the end.  but I loved all of them on the track together, despite that.  woo for CSI epis of old.  next weeks looks creepy...could be good.

-lex :-)

I got this in an e-mail, so some of you already got this, but I couldn't help but post this here. 

-lex :-)

>>The Washcloth..............
>>
>>Ladies this has to be read, laughed at and passed on. There is
>>not a woman alive today who won't crack up over this!
>>
>>I was due for an appointment with the gynecologist later in the
>>week.
>>
>>Early one morning, I received a call from the doctor's office to
>>tell me that I had been rescheduled for that morning at 9:30 am. I had only
>>just packed everyone off to work and school, and it was already around
>>8:45am. The trip to his office took about 35 minutes, so I didn't have any
>>time to spare.
>>
>>As most women do, I like to take a little extra effort over
>>hygiene when making such visits, but this time I wasn't going to be able to
>>make the full effort. So, I rushed upstairs, threw off my pajamas, wet the
>>washcloth that was sitting next to the sink, and gave myself a quick wash in
>>that area to make sure I was at least presentable. I threw the washcloth in
>>the clothes basket, donned some clothes, hopped in the car and raced to my
>>appointment.
>>
>>I was in the waiting room for only a few minutes when I was
>>called in.  Knowing the procedure, as I'm sure you do, I hopped up on the
>>table, looked over at the other side of the room and pretended that I was in
>>Paris or some other place a million miles away.
>>
>>I was a little surprised when the doctor said, "My, we have made
>>an extra effort this morning, haven't we?" I didn't respond.
>>
>>After the appointment, I heaved a sigh of relief and went home.
>>
>>The rest of the day was normal . Some shopping, cleaning, cooking.
>>
>>After school when my 6 year old daughter was playing, she called
>>out from the bathroom, "Mommy, where's my washcloth?" I told her to get
>>another one from the cupboard.
>>
>>She replied, "No, I need the one that was here by the sink, it
>>had all my glitter and sparkles saved inside it."
>>
>>Never going back to that doctor ever.

The one who seduced you and fucked you over and broke your heart in a million pieces and laughed about it: Justice (with the awesome victor garber, stupid fox)

The old flame you don't see very often any more but whom you still really enjoy getting together with for a few drinks and maybe a pleasant nostalgic romp in the sheets:   X-files (not season 8 or 9, *shudders*)

The mysterious dark gothy one whom you used to sit up with talking until 3 a.m. at weird coffeehouses and with whom you were quite smitten until you realized he really was fucking crazy:  deadliest catch

The one you spent a whole weekend in bed with and who drank up all your liquor, and whom you'd still really like to fuck again although you're relieved he doesn't actually live in town:   Six feet under

The steady: House. -->me too

The alluring stranger whom you've flirted with at parties but have never gotten really serious with: the closer

The one you hang out with and have vague fantasies about maybe having a thing with but ultimately you're just good buddies 'cause the friendship is there but the chemistry ain't: heroes

The one your friends keep introducing you to and who seems like a hell of a cool guy except it's never really gone anywhere: american idol (is that a fandom?)  if not deadwood

The one who's slept with all your friends, and you keep looking at him and thinking, "Him? How the hell did he land all these cool babes?":  Gray's Anatomy

The one your friend has fallen for like a ton of bricks and whom she keeps babbling to you about on the phone for hours, and you'd be happy for her except you just know it's going to end badly:   House-->I'll second that.

The ones you repeatedly cheat on your steady with: CSI

ok, I loved the house/wilson banter.  the whole stealing the guitar thing was freaking hilarious, esp. when he was talking into the phone with the fan.  "this guy or guys, or it could be a gal, are serious (when the piece was in the box)".  I missed that banter so much.  the girl in the ER was cute, a semi-ok replacement for cammy.  I was in  cammy withdrawl before that.  although, I did miss 4man's snippings too.  it'll be interesting to see how this plays out.  not sure how the class full of med kids will play out.  the dr. janitor (I'm blanking on the name) was great.  "please sign the consent so we can start the dialysis" repeated over again.  hehe.  this is a very random entry, but I'm a bit tipsy.  i.e. not full out drunk, but definitely tipsy.  best creation ever is my vodkade (vodka and lemonade...soo goood.)  hehe.  let me know what you guys think, pweas?

love ya,
-lex :-)

24. Tell me one interesting/odd fact about you?
25. What was your first impression of me (please be honest)?

My friend ladyjean had this posted a few days ago on her lj, and I thought it was fabulous.  So, here is the letter to always maxi-pads.  Enjoy!

-lex

 This is an actual letter sent to Proctor and Gamble from Wendi Aarons, 
Austin, TX, regarding their feminine products. She really gets rolling after 
the first paragraph...

Dear Mr. Thatcher,

I have been a loyal user of your Always Maxi Pads for over 20 years and I 
appreciate many of their features. Why, without the Leak GuardCore(tm) or 
Dri-Weave(tm) absorbency, I'd probably never go horseback riding or salsa 
dancing, and I'd certainly steer clear of running up and down the beach in 
tight, white shorts. But my favorite feature has to be your revolutionary 
Flexi-Wings. Kudos on being the only company smart enough to realize how 
crucial it is that maxi pads be aerodynamic. I can't
tell you how safe and secure I feel each month knowing there's a little F-16 
in my pants.

Have you ever had a period, Mr. Thatcher? Ever suffered from "the curse"? 
I'm guessing you haven't.

Well, my "time of the month" is starting right now. As I type, I can already 
feel hormonal forces violently surging through my body. Just a few minutes 
from now, my body will adjust and I'll be transformed into what my husband 
likes to call "an inbred hillbilly with knife skills."

As Brand Manager in the Feminine-hygiene Division, you've no doubt seen 
quite a bit of research on what exactly happens during your customers' 
monthly visits from "Aunt Flo". Therefore, you must know about the bloating, 
puffiness, and cramping we endure, and about our intense mood swings, 
crying, and out-of-control behavior. You surely realize it's a tough time 
for most women.

The point is, sir, you of all people must realize that America is just 
crawling with homicidal maniacs in Capri pants... which brings me to the 
reason for my letter.

Last month, while in the throes of cramping so painful I wanted to reach 
inside my body and yank out my uterus, I opened an Always maxi-pad, and 
there, printed on the adhesive backing, were these words: "Have a Happy 
Period."

Are you f__king kidding me? Does any part of your tiny middle-manager brain 
really think happiness - actual smiling, laughing happiness is possible 
during a period? Did anything mentioned above sound the least bit 
pleasurable? Well, did it, James? FYI, unless you're some kind of sick S&M 
freak girl, there will never be anything "happy" about a day in which you 
have to jack yourself up on Motrin and Kahlua and lock yourself in your 
house just so you don't march down to the local Kmart armed with a hunting 
rifle and a sketchy plan to end your life in a blaze of glory.

For the love of God, if you just have to slap a moronic message on a maxi 
pad, wouldn't it make more sense to say something that's actually pertinent, 
like "Put Down the Hammer" or "Vehicular Manslaughter Is Wrong", or are you 
just picking on us?

Sir, please inform your Accounting Department that, effective immediately, 
there will be an $8 drop in monthly profits, for I have
chosen to take my maxi-pad business elsewhere. And though I will certainly 
miss your Flex-Wings, I will not for one minute miss your brand of 
condescending bull s__t. And that's a promise I will keep.

Always.


Best,

Wendi Aarons
Austin, TX

I know I don't update for months, and then bam two in one day.  did anyone else know (besides cc) that the emmy's were on today?  I had no clue until I turned on the tv, and was checking out what was on after meet the press.  Can someone explain to me how James Spader won for best actor?  I figured the guy from the sopranos would have won for sure, but I didn't even know boston legal was still on.  WTF was that?  Although, I pretty much lost respect for the emmy's when they made a reality tv category.  but STILL.  all sorts of not spiffy. 

-lex

Sippewissett by Tim Traver is a phenomenonal book for a bunch of reasons.  It's about a salt marsh in Cape Cod called Sippewissett.  If you like science, but don't want to get bogged down (no pun intended, even though it's kind of a misnomer...I digress) in too much scientific jargon this book is perfect.  He writes eloquently and I love way he describes things.  He makes it easy for a non-science person to understand the science behind it all.  It's a combination of history lesson (of the area, Woods Hole, etc.), science, and his personal lifelong experiences with the marsh.  There are a lot of scientists who can't write for shit, but this guy is definitely not one of them.  I thoroughly enjoyed this book, and would encourage anyone interested in salt marshes or coastal planning in general to pick it up.  You will not be disappointed (or at least I really hope you aren't, but if you are, please let me know.)  I'd be curious to find out why (without taking your head off about it, either). 

On a different note...it was absolutely gorgeous here today, and I hope you guys took advantage if it was nice where you were too. 

-Lex :-)

ok, I know I haven't been around, like at all.  I've been crazy busy with work, and my computer sucks hairy syphillic monkey balls.  I really just need to bite the bullet and buy a new one.  So, things are going pretty well.  I visited a really good friend of mine this past week, who I haven't seen in forever.  It was so nice, and we didn't really do anything but hang out and just talk.  Hope all is well with you guys, and I'm sorry for not KIT better.  I think I caught up with all the comments from the last couple of months, but if I missed yours, I am sorry.  

-Lex :-)

I saw the movie Once today with my dad.  It was soo good.  If you love movies and if you love music, then this movie is for you because it combines both.  There's just so much to love about it.  In some parts, esp. in the beginning some of the dialogue is hard to understand, but it gets easier.  It's an indy flick, but if you can find it I can't recommend it enough.  It is rare when I am quarter way through a movie, and say to myself  "damn, this is really good."   So, that made my day.  Until I got out of the theater and went to the bathroom to realize that I started my period (I had a pantyliner on, so that was fine).  It explains why I gorged myself today and part of yesterday.  I ate soo much at lunch, it was insane.  but good times for most the day. 

I also saw my boss' baby for the first time, she's very cute.  I didn't stay too long, just dropped off a book and chatted for about 20 minutes.  It was cool to finally see the chibi (means small in japanese.  that's the only word I know, I just think it's fun to say, so I tend to use it a lot because I'm a huge dork). 


night!

-lex :-)

the devils won!  woo...my boy Jamie came through big time.  one on one with the goalie...so pretty.  it was perfect...they so needed that.  they'd pretty much been playing on their heels the last two periods.  they had a grand total of 8 shots after the first period (the first period they had 16).  so, yeah not good.  but they WON...I'm ecstatic, and have had a little too much vodka.  the way the game was going, I needed a drink.  hehe. 

*does all sorts of spiffy jig* hell yeah baby, series at 1-1.  bring it on!

-woo...

-lex :-)

I'm still sick, and it's not getting much better.  I'm less congested, but the lightedness still hasn't gone away.  I haven't gone to work since saturday morning, and I'm going a bit nuts.  I'm a bit of a workaholic, so this whole not working thing isn't spiffy.  Not to mention, I have no sick days or vacation days, so my pay check will be miniscule.  But I thought I'd let you guys know that I haven't been forgetting about you, I just haven't been on my computer in days due to the lightheadedness (which is kicking in right about now).  So, I'm going to go back to laying down, and hoping that this shit will go away already.  Frustrated as hell and wanting to be out of the house.  Sorry for the bitch session.  seems to be a theme this week.  I don't understand hypocondriacs...I'm going crazy after 5 days, how could they be sick all the time?? 

-lex :-)

I had my other glasses like 6 years (almost 7 years) and never once did a screw pop out EVER.  Occasionally the lens would pop out, but then I could just pop it back in.  I have these new glasses not even 6 months, a fucking screw popped out, causing the lens to fall out.  luckily I was at home at the time, but this definitely shakes my confidence in my glasses.  I haven't abused them or anything.  Next time fuck this plastic shit, I'm getting metal frames.  period.  *fist of fury at Nine West for making crappy, expensive glasses*  as if I needed to do another goddamn thing tomorrow.  I put in a screw from my eyeglass repair kit, but it's too long, and doesn't quite work.  so, I'm wearing my old ones.  they are a little crooked, but they'll work for now.  fucking plastic frames my ass.

Ok, I loved this episode.  It was a combo of personal stuff (yay wilson at the end, sharing a pizza with a friend, then bowing and pointing to himself, movie whatever), and medicine.  I still really liked 1 day, 1 room (I know rach, you hated it).  I heart wilson, again.  He's being more like season 1 wilson.  I didn't think it was his file either, but I didn't think he was doing it just to get high either.  "you kissed back" was a great line (and the fact that he touched his lips afterward).  but even better was foreman's, "you should be making out with cameron right now."  I think it's so cool that he maybe went into the restaurant.  Wilson:  "start small, take a chance with something other than sticking chemicals into your brain" (I might be paraphrasing).  Just loved that epi!!  Soo good.  those bastards at fox, two more weeks before the next new house (or is it 3?).  goddamn you fox!

-lex :-)

Ok, I'm really starting to fear for our survival as a species.  Have a look at this:  <lj-cut>http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/17307671/</lj-cut>.  This person is teaching our children (well, ok, Kentucky, but my point is valid). Ok, I'm a little paranoid about this.  See, I've had casual friends (in RL and online) before that have just dropped off the face of the earth.  This could be for any number of reasons that have nothing to do with me.  BUT in case I am right, and I have said something to these people (or done something, e.g. contacted you too much) to offend them please, please let me know.  Either by e-mail, IM, or whatever.  This came up when a friend and I were talking about how a person just suddenly disappearing from online after chatting with her.  It bothered her, and she wanted to know why she might have been blocked.  So, that's where this is coming from.  In case you thought this was out of the blue.

The reason I want you to tell me if I've offended anybody in anyway is because it bothers me and I wonder why.  I obsess over it for awhile, because I really don't want to be that person (goddamn does that sound lame, and I'm sorry for the phrasing).  I hate being this self-conscious, but I am, so yeah.  

This is NOT guilt trip, I swear.  I don't do guilt trips.  My parents rarely did them on me, they just told me to do something if they wanted it done.  So, I don't know how to do them, nor do I hope this is coming off as self-pity bullshit stuff.  It isn't that either.  It's way more selfish than that.  It's me not wanting to be obsessing over things I may or may not have done, and how socially inept I am.  So, do me a favor, please just tell me if you want me to stop commenting, IMing, bugging in general, etc.  Because I will, not a problem.  I just ask you tell me why, so I don't do it to the next person and annoy them, too.  

I apologize in advance for whatever.  Please just let me know, and don't be subtle.  My parents were not subtle, so I do not get subtlety.  the blunter the better.  Thanks.  

-alexis

Tagged by rara8777.   Just so all of you know, I came up with this when I was at the attention span of a toaster (thanks rach for the expression).  So, yeah, just keep that in mind.

Once tagged by this entry, the assignment is to list 10 movies: your 5 Favorites & your 5 Guilty Pleasures. Then, pick 5 of your friends and tag them. No tag backs. This explanation should be included.

Damn you, you took 2 of my tags (wasn't quite sure if that was the right wording, oh well, let me know rara, or anyone else for that matter). hmmm who else to tag... dragynflies, ladyjean, lizztheblizz, jenn_sundin13 and that's it. we rebels have to stick together.   Not sure how you make it so you can just click on the person, and their profile comes up.  I'm kinda new at this thing of posting. 

<lj-cut> movies
Favorites (not in any order)
  1. Field of Dreams  what's not to like about just randomly plowing under your major crop to build a spiffy baseball diamond, almost go bankrupt doing it, driving mid-country (he's in Iowa) to find one of his favorite writers, pretend to kidnap him (and that your finger is a gun) and take him to a ball game at Fenway?  And then drive said writer back to Iowa to see ghosts of legendary and fabulous baseball players playing in the baseball diamond in the middle of corn country.  Did I mention that only people who can see the fabulous ball players are those who have a brain?  What's not to love about that?
  2. Monty Python and the holy grail.  again, what's not to love?  "it's just a flesh wound"
  3. All About Eve, if you haven't seen this movie, you should.  It's spectacular.  Features Bette Davis, Ann Baxter, and a very young Marilyn Monroe. 
  4. Good Will Hunting  This movie was tied with something else, but this got the benefit because it's an older movie, so I have retrospect or something. 
  5. Dogma  with a cast like Jay and Silent Bob, Chris Rock, Janeane Garofalo, Jason Lee, Selma Hayek, Alan Rickman, Matt Damon, George Carlin, and Alanis Morissette,  how could you possibly go wrong?  "I think we are a little beyond euphemisms.  God's a skeeball fanatic."

Guilty Pleasures
  1. Miss Congeniality  I never get sick of this movie, and always find it hilarious.  Esp. when they are making her over and she comes out of the airplane hanger with the fans and stuff blowing her hair (and then she falls...hehe.).  Michael Caine is just splendid, and he makes this movie.  "Come on cupcake"...hehe.
  2. Goonies  I am also of goonie glory.  "Andy...you GOONIE".  ...yes, I'm tired so I'm randomly quoting movies, shush. 
  3. Lake Placid  The funniest horror movie ever.  Yay Betty White!  "I'm rooting for the crocodile, I hope he eats your friends whole." 
  4. Robin Hood:  Men in Tights.  Mel Brooks, need I say more. 
  5. Borne Supremacy every once in awhile, I need a good action flick.  </lj-cut>

discussing tonight's episode
<lj-cut> freaking hodges...I think if I were grissom I would have smacked him, once for looking on eckley's desk and then another for sitting his ass down.
-aren't sabbaticals usually longer than a month?  like usually 6 or 12...
-that answered the question about her being a supervisor, guess they just forgot about that plot twist
-look on catherine's face when she asked him how long he had known was priceless
-what a bastard that adam novack is...yay for nicky being there
-well that answers the question about the inheritance...man, did they tie up a lot of loose ends in this epi
-there's something off about the sheriff
-that's creepy, it looks the same as the other house
-even creepier that it hasn't been touched in 3 years
-he shot the rabbit, how uncool
-love when nick gets that epiphany look on his face
-catherine's tempting fate here with that guffy guy, he would tell her anything for another button
-I knew there was something off with that sheriff, but everybody has their breaking point.  I would've lost it too
-man, grissom is worse than I am with people.  Nick, I'll be back in 4 weeks, stop hugging me.  that's cold man.  
-he does too have students...you grow with the mentor, but they will always be your students and you'll always been the mentor.  
-aww, warrick's the rock.  take care of her like you've been there for me, and you'll be fine. sounds an awful like a goodbye to me
-making it crystal clear about supervisors in this episode
-wonder what's sara is going to do/say
-I love how he is trying to take care of everyone before he leaves.  that was nice with greg, get your own counsel, they will throw you under a bus to cover their own ass.
-that poor family, having to go back to the house
-awww, how cute is that kid (and really sad at the same time) about how they are waiting for him to say goodbye, and his dad.  it's finally over for them
-I can't believe he ate a cookie...ah ha, GOTCHA with a bloody fingerprint
-it's time to say goodbye dad.  dad, goodbye baby, as he's gripping his kid...AWWWW...that was pretty damn heartwrenching
-I miss greg's spikey hair
-that was a nice moment betw the creep (novack) and catherine, everyone needs justice, if not the first time around, then the second.
-here's the moment I've been waiting for I'll see ya when you get back....come on, say something you bastard, don't make the same mistake AGAIN.  AHHHH...this is killing me!  aw, he said I'll miss you, and it looked like it pained him to no end.  goddamn is he like me
-the little half smile, but the look of dejectedness is more apparent on her face
-wtf is that???  oh no, not another goddamn cliffhanger.  

All in all, one of the best episodes of the season.  Full of surprises and very understated, but in a good way.  Not understated as in non-existent and lame, but just a nice subtle tenseness throughout the whole episode.  Very nicely done.  If only they hadn't done that goddamn cliffhanger...erg.  doing those every now and then is fine, doing them every episode gets a little tedious.  still creepy though.</lj-cut>

I miss my CSI buddy, now I know how you felt when I missed that one because of the world series.  not spiffy man, hope your electric comes back on soon.  *hugs*

-Lex

I wrote this ysterday at 3 AM in response on how to annoy retail/service workers.  So, if by some chance you've read it, you can skip (although I've added some pieces).  Here's one of my famous rants <lj-cut>3 AM rants...let it begin. 
general retail stores
-get off your cell phone before asking us for something. I can think of nothing ruder than talking on a cell phone and asking the person to wait on hold for a second, ask us for help, and then continue talking. Like we should be grateful they took time out of their busy lives, and allow themselves the graciousness to bow down to the little people in retail. Just get off the goddamn phone until you are done with the salesperson.  If it is that goddamn important take it outside or something because no one wants to hear it. can you tell that it irks the shit out of me?

-please, please, please bring your shit out of the dressing room. You don't have to fold it, make it look nice, or anything, just please bring it out. you can drop it in a pile if you want to.

-if you are getting jeans/pants for someone else, if possible rip the labels off new jeans, or get the style number in the tag (it just makes everyone's life easier, if not possible, just get someone who actually knows something)

-give us a break, we don't know everything.  just be patient

-I cannot tell you how good it makes me feel when a customer tells me how well I do my job and how helpful I was.  If you feel a salesman did a really good job, please tell them.  It'll make up for all those assholes the rest of the day.  

...just a couple for those of you who go to shoe stores with actual salespeople.

if your kid is getting fitted for shoes, you have to trust the person who is doing it. I'm so sick of parents saying:
    -are you sure they have enough room
    -let's try the next size just in case
    -let me feel where his toe is, just in case I don't approve (at this point, I'm usually like, ok, whatever, you can fit the kids shoe)
    -if your kid doesn't like the shoe, they won't wear it, no matter how much you like it (I did that a lot as a kid, yeah I'll wear it and never did)

-if you are going into a store to get a specific boot for someone, try and get the style number either off an old boot box, or off the shoe itself (or you could bring it in). This is a lifesaver for picky husbands/wives/bfs/gfs who have to get the exact boot or else they are not going to be happy. happy feet=happy people=happy giftgiver

if you are calling a store with a question know these things, if possible (pretty please?) in order of importance (if you know the brand, style, you're golden)
    -brand
    -style (should be on the tag, range from 3 digits to 6 digits in length)
    -size (including width)
    -color (if applicable)
    -height (mostly applicable for work boots)
when people call and say, "I want to check to see about insert brand, but I only know the height". This is not all that helpful, unless you get a person with a considerable amount of experience and who has basically memorized styles carried and previously carried. It's ok if you don't know those things, but the salesdude will be able to track down the shoe quicker with more info.

-if you want to see 6 different styles, break it up into sets of 2 or 3. Two reasons, carrying 6 shoe styles out is a bitch, and it's really hard to keep track of gathering all of those in the first place. Give your salesdude a break, unless they ask you for all 6.

end of rant...sorry about that.</lj-cut> just how inconsiderate and stupid people are annoys me sometimes, and it just manifests itself during the holidays as 10X worse.
